alert.note: Alert for Bladen; Cumberland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 17 at 10:33AM EDT until March 21 at 5:43PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wilmington NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... Cape Fear River At William O Huske Lock And Dam 3 affecting Bladen and Cumberland Counties. Cape Fear River At Elizabethtown affecting Bladen County. For the Cape Fear River...including William O Huske Lock And Dam 3, Elizabethtown, Lock And Dam 1...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cape Fear River At William O Huske Lock And Dam 3. * WHEN...From late tonight to Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 50.0 feet, Extensive lowland flooding will occur along the river. The wildlife boat ramp at Tar Heel Ferry Road will likely be inaccessible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 37.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 50.6 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 42.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=ilm . The next statement will be issued by this evening.
